p:
For the changed habitats of S.Â alterniflora, it was spilt into eight parts in Equation (2). For c and j, they belonged to the habitats when just considering sea level rise, so they were assumed as increased and decreased habitats caused by pure effects of sea level rise ( H p
_
slr ). Similarly, n and h are increased and decreased habitats caused by pure effects of climate change ( H p
_
clc ). e and k are increased and decreased habitats shared by H CLC and H SLR, and we assumed e and k are caused by shared effects due to interactions of climate change and sea level rise ( H p
_
ics ). For b and i, they did not belong to habitats when considering only climate change or sea level rise, so, we assumed them as increased and decreased habitats caused by coupling effects due to interactions of climate change and sea level rise ( H c
_
ics ).
